creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: image in tans and oranges of silhouettes of five figures carrying jugs on their heads, accompanied by a child, right of center; silhouettes of trees; two other groups of figures in middle ground
inscription:
Signature, Title, Date, Edition and Inscription

left margin, in pencil: [?????　朝霧]{1987nen saku, Asagiri}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
signed: LLC below image, in pencil: [Morning Mist  1/100]; LRC below image, in pencil: [Toshi Yoshida]; see Inscription
title: Morning Mist
